00001 /**************************************************************************
00002 $Header: dir.c Fri 10-27-2000 8:49:52 pm HvA V1.00 $
00003 
00004 DESC: Show directory and pick a filename - HVA_WIN 
00005 HIST: 19911120 V1.00 
00006           20001027 V2.01 - Adapting for DJGPP

00011 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00012 #include <stdio.h>
00013 #include <stdlib.h>
00014 #include <conio.h>
00015 #include <string.h>
00016 #include <ctype.h>
00017 #include <dos.h>
00018 #include <direct.h>
00019 #include <unistd.h>             /*+ For getcwd() +*/
00020 #include "keys.h"
00021 #include "window.h"
00022 #include "fortify.h"
00023 
00024 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00025                         CONSTANTS
00026 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00027 #define MAX_FILES       100     /*+ Maximum number of files in a directory +*/
00028 #define CELWIDTH         14     /*+ Width of 1 cell in the window          +*/
00029 #define NO_HOR_CELLS      4     /*+ Number of names in 1 row               +*/
00030 #define NO_VERT_CELLS     9     /*+ Number of names in 1 column            +*/
00031 #define MAX_NAME_LENGTH  13     /*+ Maximum length of a filename           +*/
00032 
00033 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00034                         LOCAL VARIABLES
00035 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00036 static int window_width  = 0;
00037 static int window_height = 0;
00038 static int no_cells      = 0;
00039 static int row           = 0;
00040 static int col           = 0;
00041 static int filenr        = 0;
00042 static int no_files      = 0;
00043 static int first_file    = 0;
00044 static int parent_dir    = FALSE;
00045 
00046 #define NAMELEN 132
00047 
00048 static char original_dir[NAMELEN];  /* Starting directory               */
00049 static char full_path[NAMELEN];     /* Full path to choosen file        */
00050 static char *file[MAX_FILES];       /* Array of pointers to filenames   */
00051 static WINDOW *dir_window;
00052 
00053 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00054                         PROTOTYPES
00055 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00056 static int  check_filenr(int nr);
00057 static void get_files(char *mask);
00058 static void display_dir(void);
00059 static void calc_row_col(int nr);
00060 static int  calc_first_file(int filenr);

00063                         START OF FUNCTIONS

00066 /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00067 show-dir() - Show a directory. Asks for a filemask and then shows the
00068 directory contents, matching the mask. If the window for the mask was
00069 escaped with ESC_KEY, then don't show the direcory
00070 
00071 HISTORY: 911211 V0.1 - Initial version
00072 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
00073 void show_dir(void)
00074 {
00075   char filemask[40];
00076   int ret;
00077 
00078   strcpy(filemask,"*.*");
00079   ret = editstr(action_row+2,action_col+2,30,"File mask",filemask,_DRAW);
00080   if (ret != ESC)
00081     get_dir(filemask,filemask);
00082 }
00083 
00084 /*#+func--------------------------------------------------------------
00085     FUNCTION: change_dir()
00086      PURPOSE: change directory
00087  DESCRIPTION: shows path of current directory, and will ask for a new
00088               path. If this edit window is escaped by 'ESC' nothing
00089               will be done, otherwise we change the current directory
00090      RETURNS: nothing
00091      HISTORY: 911112 V0.1 - Initial version
00092 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------*/
00093 void change_dir()
00094 {
00095   char path[81];
00096   int  ret;
00097 
00098   if (getcwd(path,80) != NULL)
00099   {
00100     ret = editstr(action_row+2,action_col+2,30,"Enter directory path",path,_DRAW);
00101     if (ret != ESC)
00102       chdir(path);
00103   }
00104   else
00105     wn_error("Error in change_dir()");
00106 }
00107 
00108 /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
00109     FUNCTION: calc_first_file()
00110      PURPOSE: Calculate number of first file in the window
00111  DESCRIPTION: -
00112      RETURNS: nothing
00113      HISTORY: 911213 V0.1 - Initial version
00114 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00115 static int calc_first_file(int nr)
00116 {
00117   if (nr >= first_file + no_cells)
00118   {
00119     first_file += NO_HOR_CELLS;
00120     return(first_file);
00121   }
00122 
00123   if (nr < first_file)
00124   {
00125     first_file -= NO_HOR_CELLS;
00126     return(first_file);
00127   }
00128   return(nr);           /*+ Default return +*/
00129 
00130 }
00131 
00132 /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
00133     FUNCTION: check_filenr()
00134      PURPOSE: Check if filenr within valid range
00135  DESCRIPTION: -
00136      RETURNS: nothing
00137      HISTORY: 911120 V0.1 - Initial version
00138 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00139 static int check_filenr(int nr)
00140 {
00141   if (nr < 0)
00142     nr = 0;
00143   if (nr >= no_files)
00144     nr = no_files-1;
00145   return(nr);
00146 }
00147 
00148 /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
00149     FUNCTION: calc_row_col()
00150      PURPOSE: Calculate row and column of a cell number in the window
00151  DESCRIPTION: -
00152      RETURNS: nothing.
00153               Global variables 'row' and 'column' are affected.
00154      HISTORY: 911120 V0.1 - Initial version
00155 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00156 static void calc_row_col(int cell_nr)
00157 {
00158   int i;
00159 
00160   /*-----------------------------
00161     Calculate horizontal offset
00162   ------------------------------*/
00163   i   = cell_nr % NO_HOR_CELLS;
00164   col = dir_window->x1+1 + (i * CELWIDTH);
00165 
00166   /*----------------------------
00167     Calculate vertical offset
00168   ----------------------------*/
00169   i = ((int) cell_nr / NO_HOR_CELLS);
00170   if (i >= NO_VERT_CELLS)
00171     i = NO_VERT_CELLS - 1;
00172   row = dir_window->y1 + i;
00173 }
00174 
00175 /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
00176     FUNCTION: display_dir()
00177      PURPOSE: Display directory in a window
00178  DESCRIPTION: -
00179      RETURNS: nothing
00180      HISTORY: 911213 V0.1 - Initial version
00181 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00182 static void display_dir()
00183 {
00184   int j;
00185   int cell_nr;
00186 
00187   /*-----------------
00188     Initializations
00189   ------------------*/
00190   filenr = check_filenr(filenr);
00191   first_file = calc_first_file(filenr);
00192   j = first_file;
00193   cell_nr = 0;
00194 
00195   /*--------------------------
00196     Show filenames in window
00197   ---------------------------*/
00198   wn_locate(dir_window,0,0);
00199   while (cell_nr < no_cells && cell_nr < no_files) {
00200     if (!file[j][0])   /* Check if filename not empty */
00201       break;
00202     calc_row_col(cell_nr);
00203     hotstring(row,col,-1,file[j],_menu_att);
00204     cell_nr++;
00205     j++;
00206   }
00207 
00208   /*-----------------------------------
00209     Clear remainder of menu if needed
00210   ------------------------------------*/
00211   while (cell_nr < no_cells)
00212   {
00213     calc_row_col(cell_nr);
00214     hotstring(row,col,-1,"             ",_menu_att);
00215     cell_nr++;
00216   }
00217 
00218   /*----------------------------------
00219     Highlight filename under cursor
00220   ----------------------------------*/
00221   cell_nr = filenr - first_file;
00222   calc_row_col(cell_nr);
00223   hotstring(row,col,-1,file[filenr],_menu_highlight);
00224 }
00225 
00226 /*#+func---------------------------------------------------------------------
00227     FUNCTION: get_files()
00228      PURPOSE: get filenames and subdirs of current directory
00229  DESCRIPTION: -
00230      RETURNS: nothing
00231      HISTORY: 911213 V0.1 - Initial version
00232 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00233 static void get_files(char *mask)
00234 {
00235   struct find_t filedata;
00236   int i,j;
00237   char dir[81];
00238 
00239   getcwd(dir,80);
00240 
00241   /*--------------------------
00242     Make all filename empty
00243   --------------------------*/
00244   for (i=0 ; i<MAX_FILES ; i++)
00245     file[i][0] = '\0';
00246 
00247   window_width  = NO_HOR_CELLS * CELWIDTH;
00248   window_height = NO_VERT_CELLS;
00249   no_cells      = NO_HOR_CELLS * NO_VERT_CELLS;
00250 
00251   /*-----------------------------
00252     Get all matching file names
00253   ------------------------------*/
00254   no_files = 0;
00255   i = 0;
00256   if (_dos_findfirst(mask,_A_NORMAL,&filedata) == 0)
00257   {
00258     do
00259     {
00260       strcpy(file[i],filedata.name);
00261       strlwr(file[i]);
00262       j = strlen(file[i]);
00263       strncat(file[i],"            ",12-j);
00264       i++;
00265       no_files++;
00266     }
00267     while (_dos_findnext(&filedata) == 0 && no_files < MAX_FILES);
00268   }
00269 
00270   /*------------------------------------------
00271     Add subdirectories. Now use "*.*" as mask
00272   -------------------------------------------*/
00273   parent_dir = FALSE;
00274   if (_dos_findfirst("*.*",_A_SUBDIR,&filedata) == 0)
00275   {
00276     do
00277     {
00278       if (filedata.attrib & 0x10)       /* If subdirectory      */
00279       {
00280         if (filedata.name[0] == '.' && filedata.name[1] == '.')
00281           parent_dir = TRUE;
00282         if (filedata.name[0] != '.')   /* Skip current and parent directories */
00283         {
00284           strcpy(file[i],filedata.name);
00285           j = strlen(file[i]);
00286           strncat(file[i],"\\           ",12-j);
00287           i++;
00288           no_files++;
00289         }
00290       }
00291     }
00292     while (_dos_findnext(&filedata) == 0 && no_files < MAX_FILES);
00293   }
00294   if (parent_dir)
00295   {
00296     strncat(file[i++],"..\\           ",12);
00297     no_files++;
00298   }
00299 
00300 }
00301 
00302 /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
00303     FUNCTION: get_dir()
00304      PURPOSE: Show directory in a window and pick a file
00305  DESCRIPTION: Searches all files in the current directory with
00306               the mask given, and show them in a window like TC.
00307               The name of the file picked will be copied in the parameter
00308               'filename'
00309      RETURNS: NULL if this function is escaped by <ESC>
00310               pointer to full path and filename if <ENTER> was used
00311      HISTORY: 911111 V0.1 - Initial version
00312 --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00313 char *get_dir(char *mask, char *filename)
00314 {
00315   int i;
00316   unsigned int  key = ESC_KEY;
00317   char *backslash;
00318 
00319   /*--------------------------------
00320     Allocate memory for file names
00321   ---------------------------------*/
00322   for (i=0 ; i<MAX_FILES ; i++)
00323     file[i] = (char *) malloc(MAX_NAME_LENGTH);
00324 
00325   /*------------------------
00326     Get current directory
00327   ------------------------*/
00328   getcwd(original_dir,80);
00329 
00330   get_files(mask);
00331 
00332   /*------------------------
00333     Open directory window
00334   ------------------------*/
00335   dir_window = wn_open(_SINGLE_LINE, action_row+2, action_col+2,
00336     window_width+2, window_height+2, _menu_att, _border_att);
00337   wn_title(dir_window,mask);
00338 
00339   /*--------------------------
00340     Initialize variables
00341   ---------------------------*/
00342   filenr = 0;
00343   first_file = 0;
00344 
00345   while (TRUE)
00346   {
00347     /*-----------------------------
00348       Display filenames in window
00349     ------------------------------*/
00350     display_dir();
00351 
00352     key = waitkey();
00353     switch(key)
00354     {
00355        case ARROW_RIGHT:
00356          filenr++;
00357          break;
00358 
00359        case ARROW_LEFT:
00360          filenr--;
00361          break;
00362 
00363        case ARROW_DOWN:
00364          filenr += NO_HOR_CELLS;
00365          break;
00366 
00367        case ARROW_UP:
00368          filenr -= NO_HOR_CELLS;
00369          break;
00370 
00371        case ESC_KEY:
00372          filename[0] = '\0';
00373          /*------------------------
00374            Free allocated memory
00375          ------------------------*/
00376          for (i=0 ; i<MAX_FILES ; i++)
00377            free(file[i]);
00378          chdir(original_dir);     /* Go back to original directory */
00379          dir_window = wn_close(dir_window);
00380          return(NULL);
00381          break;
00382 
00383        case ENTER:
00384          /*---------------------------------------------------
00385            Check if directory selected. If so, change to this
00386            directory, get filenames and show directory
00387          -----------------------------------------------------*/
00388          backslash = strchr(file[filenr],'\\');
00389          if (backslash)
00390          {
00391            *backslash = '\0';
00392            if (chdir(file[filenr]) != -1)
00393            {
00394              get_files(mask);
00395              first_file = 0;
00396              filenr = 0;
00397              display_dir();
00398            }
00399          }
00400          else
00401          {
00402            getcwd(full_path,80);
00403            strcat(full_path,"\\");
00404            /*----------------------------
00405              Check if filename selected
00406            ----------------------------*/
00407            if (isalnum(file[filenr][0]))
00408            {
00409              strcpy(filename,file[filenr]);
00410              strcat(full_path,filename);
00411            }
00412 
00413            /*------------------------
00414              Free allocated memory
00415            ------------------------*/
00416            for (i=0 ; i<MAX_FILES ; i++)
00417              free(file[i]);
00418            chdir(original_dir);     /* Go back to original directory */
00419            dir_window = wn_close(dir_window);
00420            return(full_path);
00421          }
00422          break;
00423 
00424       default:
00425         break;
00426     } /* end of switch() */
00427   } /* end of while() */
00428 
00429 }
